item.title: Monkeypox Outbreak around the World in 2022
item.description: The outbreak of monkeypox, which is a viral disease, was confirmed in May 2022, once few cases were found in the United Kingdom. The first case was detected on 6th May 2022 and confirmed this case had travel links to Nigeria (where the disease is endemic). From 18th May 2022 onwards, there was an increase in cases in Europe, North and South America, Asia, Africa, and Australia. As of 23rd July 2
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Importance of Good Sleep for Health
item.description: Nowadays in this busy life, good sleep is very rare for all kinds of generations. Late night sleep, watching phones and computers till late at night makes our sleep very difficult. Everyone has to sleep for at least 7 to 9 hours per night. Good sleep makes the mind calm and relaxed, even a fresh day starts with good sleep. Hormone called melatonin is produced by the brain and helps to get sleep
item.dc:creator: Jyothi S N

item.title: Benefits of Aloe vera in Oral Health
item.description: Aloe vera or aloe barbadensis, is a medicinal plant which is a thick short stemmed plant that stores aloe vera gel in its leaves. It is used topically in most of today's skin diseases,sun burns,hair etc. Studies have shown that aloe vera has its own benefits in oral health as well. Aloe vera contains more vitamins and minerals. item.title: Studies estimate long COVID-19 has over two hundred Symptoms

item.title: Why Dental Implants?
item.description: Advanced dental treatments all over the world led to new advanced solutions for dental problems, one such is Implant. An implant is a medical device manufactured to replace a missing biological structure, support a damaged biological structure, or enhance an existing biological structure. item.dc:creator: Jyothi S N

item.title: Black Fungus - Detected in Coronavirus Patients
item.description: Black fungus is an infection caused by a fungus named mucormycosis. This fungal infection is being reported in a few Corona-affected patients during or post-recovery. People catch mucormycosis when they come in contact with the fungal spores in the environment. It can also be contacted through skin contact through a cut, burn, or any other form of skin trauma.
item.dc:creator: Leela Vasundhara

item.title: World Cancer Day, February 4th - Early detection of Cancer can lead to Improved outcomes & Cure.
item.description: Cancer is a large group of diseases that can start in almost any organ or tissue of the body when abnormal cells grow uncontrollably, go beyond their usual boundaries to invade adjoining parts of the body and/or spread to other organs. The latter process is called metastasizing which is a major cause of death from cancer. A neoplasm and malignant tumour are other common names for cancer.
